note.p: Death: Petite Dent de Veisivi, Val d'Herens, Switzerland (27 August 1898)
Education: Trinity College, Cambridge. BA (1871, Senior Wrangler and 1st Smith's Prizeman), MA; DSc (London)

Career: Fellow of Trinity College, Cambridge; Scientific Adviser, Lighthouse Department, Messrs Chance, Birmingham (since 1872); consulting engineer, London (1878); died in an Alpine accident, Evalona, Switzerland
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1898-1899 vol 64 pp xvii-xxiv signed by J A E
References: T M Charlton, 'Professor Bertram Hopkinson, CMG, MA, BSc, FRS (1874-1918)' in NR 1974-5 vol 29 pp 101-109
